thread.title: Authorities say small plane crashed at an air show in southern Austria, fatally injuring the pilot - @AP
thread.title_full: Authorities say small plane crashed at an air show in southern Austria, fatally injuring the pilot - @AP

author: Rebecca Bratek
title: Authorities say small plane crashed at an air show in southern Austria, fatally injuring the pilot - @AP
text:
Plane crashes at Austrian air show, fatally injuring pilot Aug. 30, 2015 12:28 PM EDT Share article 48.2085 16.3721 
VIENNA (AP) â€” A small plane crashed at an air show in southern Austria on Sunday, fatally injuring the pilot, authorities said. 
The accident happened at the Hirt airfield, near the town of Friesach in the southern province of Carinthia. 
The pilot, a 50-year-old local man, made a steep ascent and then went into a quick descent before crashing, Friesach police chief Marianne Makoru told the Austria Press Agency. 
The air show was halted after the crash. About 500 spectators attended on Sunday, but Makoru said that "no other people were in danger." 
___ 
This story has been corrected to show the spelling of the town is Friesach, not Freisach. SEE FULL ARTICLE
